org.cougaar.lib.web.engine
Class AbstractServletEngine

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.GenericStateModelAdapter
      org.cougaar.lib.web.engine.AbstractServletEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, GenericStateModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpServletEngine, TomcatServletEngine
public abstract class AbstractServletEngine
extends GenericStateModelAdapter
implements Component

This component is a base class for ServletEngineService providers.

This class reads the parameters, scans for available ports, starts the server, and advertises our service.

If HTTPS is enabled, the "cougaar.rc" must contain:

   org.cougaar.web.keystore=FILENAME
   org.cougaar.web.keypass=Password
where the FILENAME is relative to the "$cougaar.install.path". See Parameters for "cougaar.rc" documentation.

All the following parameters are also supported as prefix-free component parameters, e.g. "http.port=1234".

Constructor Detail







AbstractServletEngine


public AbstractServletEngine()














Method Detail







configure


protected abstract void configure(int httpPort,
                                  int httpsPort,
                                  java.util.Map options)




Set the HTTP and HTTPS (SSL) configuration -- this is called before
 startServer().











Parameters:
httpPort - the HTTP port, or -1 if HTTP is disabled
httpsPort - the HTTPS port, or -1 if HTTP is disabled
options - a Map of String keys to String values that specify
    additional server options (e.g. "http.acceptCount").










startServer


protected abstract void startServer()
                             throws java.net.BindException,
                                    java.io.IOException




Start the server.












Throws:

java.net.BindException - if the either the HTTP or HTTPS port is already in
   use.  The base class will then call "configure" with different port(s)
   and try to start again.

java.io.IOException - some other server exception occurred.










setGateway


protected abstract void setGateway(javax.servlet.Servlet s)
                            throws javax.servlet.ServletException




Set the single Servlet that will handle all service
 requests for the running server.
 

 Even though this is defined as setGateway(Servlet), all calls
 to:
  Servlet.service(ServletRequest, ServletResponse)
 must pass in the HTTP subclasses of these request/response interfaces:
  Servlet.service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)
 
, since this is an HTTP/HTTPS server engine.












Throws:

javax.servlet.ServletException










stopServer


protected abstract void stopServer()




Stop the server.
 

 This is only called if startServer() was called and didn't throw
 an exception.

startServer


protected AbstractServletEngine.UsedPorts startServer(java.util.Map config)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception




Start the server, scan the port range based upon the
 "org.cougaar.lib.web.scanRange" property.
 

 See the "@property" javadocs at the top of this file.












Returns:
used ports

java.lang.Exception
